title: Research Scientist in Science
description: Founded in 2014, InstaDeep is today an EMEA leader in decision-making AI products for the Enterprise, with headquarters in London, and offices in Paris, Berlin, Tunis, Lagos, Dubai, Cape Town and the USA. InstaDeep has been named among the Top 100 global AI startups for three consecutive years by CB Insights, as well as one of the 100 most promising B2B companies in Europe, by Sifted. We have created an environment that ensures a challenge by working closely with a broad spectrum of high-quality clients, pushing you to thrive in an environment that’s rarely tedious and always looking to push you to come up with outside-the-box solutions using cutting-edge technologies. In our mission to stay ahead of the curve, we are proud to partner with firms such as BioNTech SE, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA and Intel, and world-class universities such as MIT, Oxford, UCL, and Imperial College London. We are also an NVIDIA Elite Service Delivery Partner and Google Cloud Partner.Job DescriptionInstaDeep is looking for an experienced Research Scientist to join our expanding Research team in Cape Town. The research focus of the team is on generalist systems including aspects of reinforcement learning, meta-learning and foundation models. In this role, a particular focus will be on the development of novel research within the aforementioned fields applied to biological systems. Our efforts within this context are towards developing valuable research works and breakthroughs in generalist AI applied to biology that were previously out of reach.As a Research Scientist in Science, you’ll be a part of the Research Team, working on some of the most challenging areas of computational biology (such as drug design, protein folding, and molecular property prediction) using artificial intelligence. The role of a Research Scientist is to help shape and drive our ambitious research agenda, to publish in leading journals and at conferences, and to support InstaDeep’s applied BioAI projects. Individuals in this role are expected to be accomplished in computational biology and machine learning, with demonstrated expertise in at least one area evidenced by relevant academic/industrial experience or publications.We welcome applications from any background and foster an open and accepting environment. InstaDeepers are naturally helpful people who want to help others grow and succeed. We strongly encourage and support applications from underrepresented groups in the tech industry .Responsibilities Collaborate with other researchers and domain experts to develop machine-learning methods for problems in computational biology.  Lead a team of researchers and engineers in solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.  Contribute to the design and implementation of models, tools and libraries to accelerate our research effort.  Adapt neural network algorithms to deploy on supercomputing architectures to best exploit modern parallel environments.  Report and present experimental results and research findings clearly and effectively, both internally and externally, verbally and in writing.  Contribute to the team’s publication efforts.  Bridge the gap between the research and product teams by integrating new fundamental research into applied projects. Requirements Work permit for South Africa.  PhD. degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning or a related field.  A demonstrated ability to successfully deliver high-quality research, for example through the publication of scientific papers in journals or conferences.  Experience using Deep Learning frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow and/or Jax.  Experience in developing and debugging in Python or similar languages.  Excellent communication skills and collaborative spirit. Nice-To-Haves 2-5 years of industrial research experience with a focus on leading a team in solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.  Reinforcement Learning, Meta-Learning, and/or Natural Language Processing expertise.  Structural biology or molecular dynamics experience. Benefits Competitive salary.  Work in small, diverse teams on collaborative research where you can make an impact.  Cooperation across European, UK, US and African offices  Flexible working hours.  Supportive atmosphere and unique opportunities to grow, learn and contribute to the larger research community. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion commitmentsAt InstaDeep, we empower individuals to celebrate their uniqueness. Our team comes from all walks of life, and we highly encourage and support applicants to apply from underrepresented groups. Our commitment to creating an authentic environment comes from our ability to learn and grow from our diversity.At present we operate in a hybrid way allowing work from home or work from the office as per each individual’s preferences. We are continuing to review the situation with the well-being of InstaDeepers at the forefront of our minds.Right to work : Please note you will require the legal right to work in the location you are applying for. Any further questions please do not hesitate to contact us at: talent@instadeep.comExamples of our research at the intersection of AI and biology Designing a Prospective COVID-19 Therapeutic with Reinforcement Learning  Peptide-MHC Structure Prediction With Mixed Residue and Atom Graph Neural Network  ManyFold: an efficient and flexible library for training and validating protein folding models  Early Computational Detection of Potential High Risk SARS-CoV-2 Variants

You will be working with the Research and Development team and will be responsible for developing and applying advanced data science techniques to explore and analyse large datasets.The successful candidate will have responsibility for the creation of predictive models and the development of data-driven solutions to address operational problems. You will be reporting to the Head of Data Science.Key ResponsibilitiesDeveloping and applying advanced data science techniques to explore and analyse large datasets.Creating predictive models and developing data-driven solutions to address operational problems.Utilising software tools for data analysis, data preparation and data visualisation.Collaborating with researchers to identify new sources of data.Developing data-driven products and services to support the Environmental Team.Identifying data trends and patterns and developing insights to drive business decisions.Assessing the accuracy and reliability of data and data systems.Technical Skills RequiredExpertise in data modelling and data mining.Proficiency in the use of programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.Experience with Deep Learning (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras).Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modelling techniques.Ability to design, develop and implement data-driven solutions.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.If you are motivated and looking for an exciting new challenge, please apply now for immediate consideration and interview.We look forward to hearing from you!In Technology Group Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

title: Data Scientist - Cape Town based
description: IQbusiness is a leading independent management consulting firm.We are currently seeking to appoint experienced Data Scientists who are based in Cape Town, Bellville or surrounds to provide statistical analysis, forecasting, predictive modelling, simulation and optimisation to discover trends, opportunities and threats and communicate findings to business users in order to answer business questions.KEY OUTCOMESProvide business insights through statistical analysis, forecasting, predictive modelling, simulation and optimisation. to Identify, explore, examine, integrate and scrub data from multiple disparate data sources required to answer complex business questions.Design advanced analytics (quantitative) models that will answer key business questions or discover opportunities for improvement, increased revenue or reduced costs.Analyse model results, interpret findings and communicate these findings in commercial terms to Business Users so that the business impact is clearly understood.Confidently and clearly communicate analytical results to both technical and non-technical audiences.Recommend solutions for creating revenue and reducing costs/loss based on model results.Run and automate regular reporting and operationalise successful models.Establish effective and collaborative partnerships with BI Analysts / Data Scientists / Use Case Owners in the businessWork closely with the Data Analyst(s) to assist in answering complex business problems that require statistical analysis.Regularly monitor internal and external customer needs and make appropriate recommendations.Remain current with retail industry and Business Intelligence and data trends that will have business strategy implications or can be used to support recommendations to continually ‘test and learn/ to generate value.Remain current with developments in advanced analytics and methodologies.Establish effective and collaborative partnerships with relevant business and IT teams, particularly the BI source systems.Remain current with developments in advanced analytics technology and methodologies.Monitor and report on the progress of IT management’s remediation of IT audit findings and IT risks.Contribute to the assessment and selection of IT GRC applications, solutions and servicesCore RequirementsDegree in applied statistics, mathematics, operational research, economics, data engineering, risk management or equivalent industry training and experience.A minimum of 5 years in advanced analytics and optimisation of which at least 1 -2 years experience must be with the building of data modelsThe ability to look at a model and evaluate itExperience with data manipulation and analysis using SAS and SQL skills or equivalent analytical platform skills.Experience with Python coding (basic to intermediate skill level)Business acumenAs Well As In depth knowledge of Data Warehousing and BI environments Strong theoretical and practical knowledge of advanced analytical techniques, including: statistical methods, segmentation, experimental design, neural networks, data mining, optimisation techniques. Ability to identify which business problems will have the most value to the organisation if addressed through an advanced analytics solution. Ability to deal with situations where there are a lot of unknowns.Additional Criteria Advanced degree (honours or masters) preferred. Experience with Big Data ecosystems and SAS and SQL skills or equivalent analytical platform skills advantageous. Deeply curious and a strong desire to go beneath the surface of a problem. Courage to question existing assumptions and business processes and the ability to drive change and influence how the organisation approaches business challenges.Please note: As all IQbusiness roles require honesty in the handling of or access to cash, finances, financial systems, or confidential information; our recruitment process requires that the following background checks be completed: credit, criminal, ID, and qualification verification.Please also note that by applying to this position you are granting us permission to process your data for recruiting purposes. You may also be required to disclose your vaccine status pertaining to Covid-19.IQbusiness is committed to sustainable growth and transformation, we embrace diversity and employ previously disadvantaged individuals.

description: Role: Junior Data ScientistSalary: £40,000Location: OxfordWe are looking for an enthusiastic Junior Data Scientist to join our client's Environmental Team based in Oxford. You will be working with the Research and Development team and will be responsible for developing and applying advanced data science techniques to explore and analyse large datasets.The successful candidate will have responsibility for the creation of predictive models and the development of data-driven solutions to address operational problems. You will be reporting to the Head of Data Science.Key ResponsibilitiesDeveloping and applying advanced data science techniques to explore and analyse large datasets.Creating predictive models and developing data-driven solutions to address operational problems.Utilising software tools for data analysis, data preparation and data visualisation.Collaborating with researchers to identify new sources of data.Developing data-driven products and services to support the Environmental Team.Identifying data trends and patterns and developing insights to drive business decisions.Assessing the accuracy and reliability of data and data systems.Technical Skills RequiredExpertise in data modelling and data mining.Proficiency in the use of programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.Experience with Deep Learning (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras).Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modelling techniques.Ability to design, develop and implement data-driven solutions.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.If you are motivated and looking for an exciting new challenge, please apply now for immediate consideration and interview.We look forward to hearing from you!In Technology Group Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

title: Advisor Artificial Intelligence (Al) for Sustainable Development
description: Project: FAIR Forward - Artificial Intelligence for AllReports to: Cluster CoordinatorAssignment Period: Contract ends on 30.06.2022Job Description "FAIR Forward - Artificial Intelligence for All" is a new initiative of German Development Cooperation. It strives for a more open, inclusive and sustainable approach to AI on an international level. Its principal objective is to enhance key conditions in selected partner countries needed to trigger the development of local AI solutions. These local AI solutions can then help to foster sustainable human development. To achieve this, the initiative is working together with five partner countries: Ghana, Rwanda, South Africa, Uganda and India. To enhance key conditions for local AI, the initiative pursues the following three goals thus Strengthen Local Technical Know - How on AI - Capacity Building, Remove Entry Barriers to AI - Access to Training Data and AI Technologies for Local Innovation and Develop Policy Frameworks Ready for AI - Ethical AI, Data Protection and Privacy. In Ghana, the cooperation will build on existing initiatives of German development cooperation. This includes a cooperation with UN Global Pulse and the Tech-Entrepreneurship Initiative Make-IT. Further activities to establish German development cooperation as an innovative partner for digital solutions in Ghana are planned and will follow in the coming months.Tasks Manage the development and implementation of project initiatives on "artificial intelligence for all in Ghana - this will involve the set-up and steering of innovative pilots on AI, e.g. on "Access to Training Data and AI Technologies for Local Innovation" Cooperate with a broad range of stakeholder on AI, mainly governmental partner institutions, the private sector and civil society organizations in Ghana - this will involve high-level negotiations with international and national companies and institutions of the global and local digital economy and co-management of joint initiatives Provide advice on "Policy Frameworks Ready for AI - Ethical AI, Data Protection and Privacy" to government partner institutions in Ghana and manage cooperation on this goal with international partners such as "UN Global Pulse" Support the coordination and scaling up of project activities with other digital activities of German development cooperation, which will start in Ghana in the coming months. Support the management of subcontractors and supervision of events, consultancies and studies, and monitoring and evaluation of measures on AI in Ghana Manage meetings and events of the initiative in Ghana with other stakeholders and service providers (preparation, implementation, follow-up, information flow) Ensure knowledge transfer within the global implementing team of FAIR Forward and provide inputs for various project reports including annual reports Facilitate administrative and logistical procedures for activities in coordination with the GIZ administration team Other tasks as requiredQualification Required & ExperienceYour Profile Minimum requirement MA/MSc in political sciences, computer sciences, international relations, studies related to sustainable human development with a focus on digital topics, or other fields in an area related to the project objectives At least five (5) years of professional experience in a comparable position, project management and preferably in a development cooperation context and in international contexts In depth knowledge in advisory services and innovative events Technical expertise in the area of Artificial Intelligence or data science or related fields such as data application for development (data4development) Excellent work experience in policy advice on digital development / digital transformation with governmental partners Ability to take responsibility and work on own initiative as a focal point Team oriented, analytical and communicative skills, also in cross-country, cross-cultural teams Fluent written and oral knowledge of the English language; working knowledge of German is an advantage Very good working knowledge of digital technologies (Internet, software) and computer applications (e.g. Office Applications, virtual team platforms) Willingness to upskill as required by the tasks to be performed - corresponding measures are agreed with management Disciplined and punctual; willingness to keep deadlinesOur OfferCompetitive GIZ salary grid, SSNIT, Health insurance, as well as 13th Month Salary and Annual Bonus.Location: AccraHow To Apply For The JobInterested and suitable applicants are to forward their detailed Curriculum Vitae (CV) and a one–page cover letter to:under the job code 2019/ NIED-FAIR/ 11/01Closing Date: 27 December, 2019

title: Senior Data Scientist (CPT)
description: Senior Data Scientist (CPT) IT - Analyst, Data ManagementCape Town - Western CapeENVIRONMENT:EVOLVE the Retail ADA strategy development, implementation, analysis & tracking of a leading Independent Management Consultancy seeking your expertise as a Senior Data Scientist to join its team. You will be responsible for developing retail Analytical Data Assets (ADA's) and accompanying strategies for key retail use cases through using data analysis and predictive modelling techniques, simulation and optimisation to discover trends, opportunities and threats. The successful incumbent must possess a University Degree in Business/Mathematics/Statistics or Operational Research or Economics or Engineering or Risk Management or equivalent industry training and experience. You will require 3-5 years' analytical experience on a consumer portfolio dataset (Retail, Banking, Telecoms etc.) - Retail experience advantageous with proven strategy development and implementation experience using ADA analytics, Advanced Excel, Word, PowerPoint & SAS programming.DUTIES:Evolve the Retail ADA strategy development, implementation, analysis and tracking. Evaluate the performance of ADA strategies that will answer key business questions or discover opportunities for improvement, increased revenue or reduced costs. Document, recommend and present key ADA results/findings and design improved strategies that will outperform previous strategies, following the appropriate governance processes for strategy approval. Provide forecasting and regular ADA MI. Forecasting of key ADA metrics as per operating plans. Timely and accurate production of MI reports to track ADA performance and variance analysis explaining actual values against business forecasts. Make appropriate recommendations to address unfavourable variances. Lead Analytical Projects. Develop and drive project plans for major ADA development including securing resources to ensure its on-time, within budget and to-quality implementation. Prove the business effectiveness and/or efficiency of analytically driven implementations (Post-Implementation Reviews) and based on proven results or convincing analytical prediction, recommend and implement appropriate champion / challenger strategies to continually "test and learn" to improve ADA profitability. Contribute to quality and governance standards. Oversee and ensure that ADA analytics are performed to the required standards. Ensure awareness, adherence and compliance to the Governance Policies and any other related policies and procedures. Provide effective stakeholder and resource management. Align ADA implementations to relevant Business Unit resourcing requirements to ensure they're on-time, within budget and to the required standards. Effectively integrate with relevant stakeholders to ensure implementation practicality and business quality as appropriate. Coach and mentor Data Scientists, Analysts and others in the team as required. REQUIREMENTS:Qualifications -University Degree in Business or Mathematics or Statistics or Operational Research or Economics or Engineering or Risk Management or equivalent industry training and experience. Experience/Skills -At least 3-5 years analytical experience on a consumer portfolio dataset (Retail, Banking, Telecoms etc.). Retail experience advantageous. Proven strategy development and implementation experience using ADA analytics and techniques across the consumer life cycle. Experience in working in an outsourced environment and effectively implementing solutions using both internal and external resources. Experience in SAS Advanced programming (or equivalent) for statistical analysis and manipulation of very large data sets. Deep knowledge of the Retail Industry and its operating dynamics. Proven ability in analytics, business acumen and presenting / communicating recommendations across all organisation levels. Ability to work with diverse teams to ensure effective implementation of projects. Understanding of financial metrics in relation to ADA management and the associated forecasting thereof. Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint etc.), ideally using macros. Ability to cross check data integrity after an initial validation exercise. Comprehensive understanding of portfolio fields and data relationships in order to improve the analytical recommendations. Apply for this Job

description: The data science practice at Teradata delivers business insights and value to clients through big data analytics. Our data solutions integrate into engineering and decision-making processes. Additionally, we offer advisory services to our clients including use case prioritization, tool selection, training, and capability definitions.Teradata is expanding its data science team in Cairo.We are looking for data scientists that are…Highly self-motivatedIndependentKeen on learning and continuous self-developmentJob ResponsibilitiesAs a data scientist, you will independently and as part of a teamPerform all the phases of a data science project business understanding, data understanding and preparation, exploratory analysis, modeling, model evaluation, communicating results and business value of a model to the client and finally deploying your data product.Follow team development processes.Based on the nature of the project and the available tools, learn, and adapt quickly to different technologies and tools than the ones you are used to.As a principal, you are expected toLead and mentor data scientists in client projectsFocus on the business value generated by artificial intelligenceInterface more frequently with clientsImprove team processesBe tools agnosticQualificationsSc. or Ph.D. in machine learning or a relevant discipline.Expert level in Python including Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learnSolid understanding of deep learning techniquesFamiliar with PySpark and MLlibFamiliar with Excel, Tableau or PowerBI for visualizationNatural Language Processing experienceHave considerable experience in any of the following domains telco, government, or bankingIntermediate level in either C, Java, C++, or C#Intermediate level in SQLSoftware engineering experience (OOP, Agile methodologies, Git, continuous development, etc.)Familiar with Docker, Kubernetes, DevOPS and MLopsAnalytical rigorExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent technical & business presentation skillsAbility to do pre-sales activitiesProfessional consulting background at the corporate levelOur CompanyTeradata is the connected multi-cloud data platform for enterprise analytics company. Our enterprise analytics solve business challenges from start to scale. Only Teradata gives you the flexibility to handle the massive and mixed data workloads of the future, today.The Teradata Vantage architecture is cloud native, delivered as-a-service, and built on an open ecosystem. These design features make Vantage the ideal platform to optimize price performance in a multi-cloud environment.

title: Data Scientist
description: You love to help organizations become successful with Data and Artificial Intelligence. You enjoy solving complex problems and offering practical conclusions based on real business data. You feel comfortable to approach stakeholders and help them to uncover the needs of their business. And you are not afraid to take ownership and make sure the right solution goes into production. This is a job for you! The Data Value Measurement is a brand-new approach that helps organization to perform and improve their processes in terms of value generation. You will be part of a global program inside Orange with interactions with countries from Europe, Middle East Africa and entities within OBS (Orange Business Services), WIN (Wholesale International Network). The core team is leading the governance and defining recommendation to execute the value measurement. We are supporting teams to uncover the value areas per business domain. You will be part of a dynamic and agile team, composed by five people: the program director, two data translators, financial guy, and you. You will work alongside other core team members and report directly to the program director. The Data Value Measurement methodology foundation is based on a cross-functional team: data squad, business owners and the financial guy. We need a new talent, who: · Is entrepreneurial at heart, a strong communicator.· Loves to share your knowledge with peers and conduct research and analysis in order to come up with a suitable solution to a tricky business problem: How to measure the value generated by AI initiatives? · Has an effective knowledge in a specific application domain, such as network, marketing, process mining, fraud...· Has an expertise in working with data in public Cloud (Google, AWS, Azure) As a Data scientist evangelist, you will support Data squad to proceed the methodology and prepare the live monitoring of the use case. Partner with your peers, the local data team, and help them to translate the model’s outputs into outcomes used for measuring the business impact and the financial performance,Write clear documentation such as Notebooks that ease the methodology execution from the benefit curve computation to the AB testing execution for the live monitoring,Demonstrate the value generation with accurate value cockpit that gives a hands-on dashboard with financial, data and business metrics,Conduct a study and help the core team to emphasis the replication principle for scaling the measurement.a core team member, you will contribute to the animation of the governance at several level of the organizationThe monthly Big Rocks review, a meeting that provides to “Codir” of Data and AI and overview of key achievements and issues to tackle at the group level.The monthly Steerco meeting, a sync meeting with Data Value Leaders from countries. We are seeking momentum and showcasing a new assessment or changing inside the methodology.The weekly Open Coffee session, a recurring webinar with doers. We are addressing key topics of the methodology to ease adoption and acculturate people with value measurement. What you need to know/have regarding the context you will evolve Clear presentation to explain the “why” behind - Strong ability to understand the big picture and deliver results in a partnering and collaborative style with both software engineers and business representative.Results focus, problem solving acumen - Experience in running workshops and communicating results to stakeholders whatever their skills in Data and AI related work.Recommend the right metric - Use predictive modeling, optimization, and/or machine learning analytics techniques (clustering, dimensionality reduction, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, natural language understanding, deep learning networks) and tools/programming languagesFocus on replication - Understanding of cloud-based deployments and ability in working with public cloud frameworks (such as Google Cloud or AWS or Microsoft Azure) What will make you the proper candidate for this job positionStrong communication skills in English (and French is a plus)Good leadership skills and ability to work under pressureAutonomy and ability to work in a multicultural environmentGood understanding of CI-CD concepts and practical experience in deploying predictive models using CI-CD frameworks (aka MLOps)Strong knowledge theorical in data science (data viz, predictive models, …)Education and experience- Master’s degree in data science and Machine learning with at least 3 years of experience.

title: Research Scientist in Science
description: Founded in 2014, InstaDeep is today an EMEA leader in decision-making AI products for the Enterprise, with headquarters in London, and offices in Paris, Berlin, Tunis, Lagos, Dubai, Cape Town and the USA. InstaDeep has been named among the Top 100 global AI startups for three consecutive years by CB Insights, as well as one of the 100 most promising B2B companies in Europe, by Sifted. We have created an environment that ensures a challenge by working closely with a broad spectrum of high-quality clients, pushing you to thrive in an environment that’s rarely tedious and always looking to push you to come up with outside-the-box solutions using cutting-edge technologies. In our mission to stay ahead of the curve, we are proud to partner with firms such as BioNTech SE, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA and Intel, and world-class universities such as MIT, Oxford, UCL, and Imperial College London. We are also an NVIDIA Elite Service Delivery Partner and Google Cloud Partner.Job DescriptionInstaDeep is looking for an experienced Research Scientist to join our expanding Research team in Cape Town. The research focus of the team is on generalist systems including aspects of reinforcement learning, meta-learning and foundation models. In this role, a particular focus will be on the development of novel research within the aforementioned fields applied to biological systems. Our efforts within this context are towards developing valuable research works and breakthroughs in generalist AI applied to biology that were previously out of reach.As a Research Scientist in Science, you’ll be a part of the Research Team, working on some of the most challenging areas of computational biology (such as drug design, protein folding, and molecular property prediction) using artificial intelligence. The role of a Research Scientist is to help shape and drive our ambitious research agenda, to publish in leading journals and at conferences, and to support InstaDeep’s applied BioAI projects. Individuals in this role are expected to be accomplished in computational biology and machine learning, with demonstrated expertise in at least one area evidenced by relevant academic/industrial experience or publications.We welcome applications from any background and foster an open and accepting environment. InstaDeepers are naturally helpful people who want to help others grow and succeed. We strongly encourage and support applications from underrepresented groups in the tech industry .Responsibilities Collaborate with other researchers and domain experts to develop machine-learning methods for problems in computational biology.  Lead a team of researchers and engineers in solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.  Contribute to the design and implementation of models, tools and libraries to accelerate our research effort.  Adapt neural network algorithms to deploy on supercomputing architectures to best exploit modern parallel environments.  Report and present experimental results and research findings clearly and effectively, both internally and externally, verbally and in writing.  Contribute to the team’s publication efforts.  Bridge the gap between the research and product teams by integrating new fundamental research into applied projects. Requirements Work permit for South Africa.  PhD. degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning or a related field.  A demonstrated ability to successfully deliver high-quality research, for example through the publication of scientific papers in journals or conferences.  Experience using Deep Learning frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow and/or Jax.  Experience in developing and debugging in Python or similar languages.  Excellent communication skills and collaborative spirit. Nice-To-Haves 2-5 years of industrial research experience with a focus on leading a team in solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.  Reinforcement Learning, Meta-Learning, and/or Natural Language Processing expertise.  Structural biology or molecular dynamics experience. Benefits Competitive salary.  Work in small, diverse teams on collaborative research where you can make an impact.  Cooperation across European, UK, US and African offices  Flexible working hours.  Supportive atmosphere and unique opportunities to grow, learn and contribute to the larger research community. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion commitmentsAt InstaDeep, we empower individuals to celebrate their uniqueness. title: Data Scientist
description: You love to help organizations become successful with Data and Artificial Intelligence. You enjoy solving complex problems and offering practical conclusions based on real business data. You feel comfortable to approach stakeholders and help them to uncover the needs of their business. And you are not afraid to take ownership and make sure the right solution goes into production. This is a job for you! The Data Value Measurement is a brand-new approach that helps organization to perform and improve their processes in terms of value generation. You will be part of a global program inside Orange with interactions with countries from Europe, Middle East Africa and entities within OBS (Orange Business Services), WIN (Wholesale International Network). The core team is leading the governance and defining recommendation to execute the value measurement. We are supporting teams to uncover the value areas per business domain. You will be part of a dynamic and agile team, composed by five people: the program director, two data translators, financial guy, and you. You will work alongside other core team members and report directly to the program director. The Data Value Measurement methodology foundation is based on a cross-functional team: data squad, business owners and the financial guy. We need a new talent, who: · Is entrepreneurial at heart, a strong communicator.· Loves to share your knowledge with peers and conduct research and analysis in order to come up with a suitable solution to a tricky business problem: How to measure the value generated by AI initiatives? · Has an effective knowledge in a specific application domain, such as network, marketing, process mining, fraud...· Has an expertise in working with data in public Cloud (Google, AWS, Azure) As a Data scientist evangelist, you will support Data squad to proceed the methodology and prepare the live monitoring of the use case. Partner with your peers, the local data team, and help them to translate the model’s outputs into outcomes used for measuring the business impact and the financial performance,Write clear documentation such as Notebooks that ease the methodology execution from the benefit curve computation to the AB testing execution for the live monitoring,Demonstrate the value generation with accurate value cockpit that gives a hands-on dashboard with financial, data and business metrics,Conduct a study and help the core team to emphasis the replication principle for scaling the measurement.a core team member, you will contribute to the animation of the governance at several level of the organizationThe monthly Big Rocks review, a meeting that provides to “Codir” of Data and AI and overview of key achievements and issues to tackle at the group level.The monthly Steerco meeting, a sync meeting with Data Value Leaders from countries. We are seeking momentum and showcasing a new assessment or changing inside the methodology.The weekly Open Coffee session, a recurring webinar with doers. We are addressing key topics of the methodology to ease adoption and acculturate people with value measurement. What you need to know/have regarding the context you will evolve Clear presentation to explain the “why” behind - Strong ability to understand the big picture and deliver results in a partnering and collaborative style with both software engineers and business representative.Results focus, problem solving acumen - Experience in running workshops and communicating results to stakeholders whatever their skills in Data and AI related work.Recommend the right metric - Use predictive modeling, optimization, and/or machine learning analytics techniques (clustering, dimensionality reduction, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, natural language understanding, deep learning networks) and tools/programming languagesFocus on replication - Understanding of cloud-based deployments and ability in working with public cloud frameworks (such as Google Cloud or AWS or Microsoft Azure) What will make you the proper candidate for this job positionStrong communication skills in English (and French is a plus)Good leadership skills and ability to work under pressureAutonomy and ability to work in a multicultural environmentGood understanding of CI-CD concepts and practical experience in deploying predictive models using CI-CD frameworks (aka MLOps)Strong knowledge theorical in data science (data viz, predictive models, …)Education and experience- Master’s degree in data science and Machine learning with at least 3 years of experience.

We are leveraging AI to build software systems focussed on security and protecting society as we know it.We care about the influence of AI and ensuring it positively affects our everyday lives and by creating a conversation about this technology we can prove its benefits.On our mission to build and deploy these world-leading technology systems, we are looking for AI Engineers that can join in our vision for the future, by tackling some of the most complex challenges in AI technology.As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for integrating pioneering research and models into complex systems, with an outcome-oriented approach.You will work internal and external stakeholders to define project requirements, identify challenges and opportunities, and co-ordinate with customers to outline technological capabilities.To Be a Suitable Candidate, You Will HaveA relevant degree i.e. computer science or electrical engineeringCommercial experience using Rust (supported by experience with other languages, such as Python, C++ or JavaBe interested in solving some of the hardest challenges in AI systemsYou Will Benefit FromSalary up to £130k (DOE)Hybrid workingEquity optionsWorking alongside a world-class team of engineers, researchers and clientsApply now for immediate consideration for this excellent Senior Rust Engineer opportunity!Understanding Recruitment is acting as an employment agency for this Senior Rust Engineer vacancy.

title: Data Scientist-(H/F)
description: Vos missions au quotidienLe Data Scientist a pour mission la conception, le développement et l'amélioration de modèles analytiques permettant de créer de la valeur ajoutée pour les métiers et d'aider la banque dans ses prises de décision.Missions principales :Développer des use cases de bout en bout, en collaboration avec la Digital Factory ainsi que les lignes métiersConcevoir et développer les modèles de machine learning et de data mining nécessaires à la livraison de la solution définie par l’équipe projetFaire évoluer les modélisations et améliorer l'efficacité des modèles conçus tenant compte des retours des métiers ainsi que des résultats terrains obtenusRécupérer et analyser les données pertinentes liées au processus de production de l’entreprise, à la vente ou encore liées aux données client et ce afin d'apporter une information décisionnelleConstruire des algorithmes permettant d’améliorer les résultats de recherches et de ciblageÉlaborer des modèles prédictifs afin d’anticiper l’évolution des données et tendances relatives à l’activité de l’entrepriseModéliser les résultats d'analyse des données et les présenter avec des recommandations et des plans d'actions exploitables par les managers métierAnalyser les données, mettre en place des reportings, via l'outil 'Data Vis', qui serviront la prise de décision et formuler des recommandations BusinessParticiper au recrutement d’experts Big Data pour compléter l’équipe qui travaille sur le traitement des donnéesFaire de la recherche et développement relative au traitement de grands volumes de donnéesAutomatiser et sécuriser le traitement Data Science sur les plateformes dédiéesMener une veille sur les sujets relatifs à son périmètre et être une force de proposition et d'innovation Et si c’était vous ?Profil recherché :De Formation Bac +5, diplôme d'ingénieur ou diplôme en mathématiques, statistiques, économétrie.5 ans d'expérience dans le développement et l’application de modèles prédictifsCompétences métier :Méthodologies AnalyticsApprentissage automatique (Machine Learning)Exploration de donnéesStatistiquesAlgorithme / Codage / Programmation Pourquoi nous choisir ?Chez Société Générale, nous sommes convaincus que les personnes sont moteurs du changement, et que le monde de demain sera fait de toutes leurs initiatives, des plus petites aux plus ambitieuses.Que vous nous rejoigniez pour quelques mois, quelques années ou toute votre carrière, ensemble nous avons les moyens d’avoir un impact positif sur l’avenir. Créer, oser, innover, entreprendre font partie de notre ADN.Si vous aussi vous souhaitez être dans l’action, évoluer dans un environnement stimulant et bienveillant, vous sentir utile au quotidien et développer ou renforcer votre expertise, nous sommes faits pour nous rencontrer !Nous sommes un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à promouvoir tous les talents, quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, origine ethnique, nationalité, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

title: Senior Data Scientist (CPT)
description: Senior Data Scientist (CPT) IT - Analyst, Data ManagementCape Town - Western CapeENVIRONMENT:EVOLVE the Retail ADA strategy development, implementation, analysis & tracking of a leading Independent Management Consultancy seeking your expertise as a Senior Data Scientist to join its team. You will be responsible for developing retail Analytical Data Assets (ADA's) and accompanying strategies for key retail use cases through using data analysis and predictive modelling techniques, simulation and optimisation to discover trends, opportunities and threats. The successful incumbent must possess a University Degree in Business/Mathematics/Statistics or Operational Research or Economics or Engineering or Risk Management or equivalent industry training and experience. You will require 3-5 years' analytical experience on a consumer portfolio dataset (Retail, Banking, Telecoms etc.) - Retail experience advantageous with proven strategy development and implementation experience using ADA analytics, Advanced Excel, Word, PowerPoint & SAS programming.DUTIES:Evolve the Retail ADA strategy development, implementation, analysis and tracking. Evaluate the performance of ADA strategies that will answer key business questions or discover opportunities for improvement, increased revenue or reduced costs. Document, recommend and present key ADA results/findings and design improved strategies that will outperform previous strategies, following the appropriate governance processes for strategy approval. Provide forecasting and regular ADA MI. Forecasting of key ADA metrics as per operating plans. Timely and accurate production of MI reports to track ADA performance and variance analysis explaining actual values against business forecasts. Make appropriate recommendations to address unfavourable variances. Lead Analytical Projects. Develop and drive project plans for major ADA development including securing resources to ensure its on-time, within budget and to-quality implementation. Prove the business effectiveness and/or efficiency of analytically driven implementations (Post-Implementation Reviews) and based on proven results or convincing analytical prediction, recommend and implement appropriate champion / challenger strategies to continually "test and learn" to improve ADA profitability. Contribute to quality and governance standards. Oversee and ensure that ADA analytics are performed to the required standards. Ensure awareness, adherence and compliance to the Governance Policies and any other related policies and procedures. Provide effective stakeholder and resource management. Align ADA implementations to relevant Business Unit resourcing requirements to ensure they're on-time, within budget and to the required standards. Effectively integrate with relevant stakeholders to ensure implementation practicality and business quality as appropriate. Coach and mentor Data Scientists, Analysts and others in the team as required. REQUIREMENTS:Qualifications -University Degree in Business or Mathematics or Statistics or Operational Research or Economics or Engineering or Risk Management or equivalent industry training and experience. Experience/Skills -At least 3-5 years analytical experience on a consumer portfolio dataset (Retail, Banking, Telecoms etc.). Retail experience advantageous. Proven strategy development and implementation experience using ADA analytics and techniques across the consumer life cycle. Experience in working in an outsourced environment and effectively implementing solutions using both internal and external resources. Experience in SAS Advanced programming (or equivalent) for statistical analysis and manipulation of very large data sets. Deep knowledge of the Retail Industry and its operating dynamics. Proven ability in analytics, business acumen and presenting / communicating recommendations across all organisation levels. Ability to work with diverse teams to ensure effective implementation of projects. Understanding of financial metrics in relation to ADA management and the associated forecasting thereof. Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint etc.), ideally using macros. Ability to cross check data integrity after an initial validation exercise. Comprehensive understanding of portfolio fields and data relationships in order to improve the analytical recommendations. Apply for this Job

Additionally, we offer advisory services to our clients including use case prioritization, tool selection, training, and capability definitions.Teradata is expanding its data science team in Cairo.We are looking for data scientists that are…Highly self-motivatedIndependentKeen on learning and continuous self-developmentJob ResponsibilitiesAs a data scientist, you will independently and as part of a teamPerform all the phases of a data science project business understanding, data understanding and preparation, exploratory analysis, modeling, model evaluation, communicating results and business value of a model to the client and finally deploying your data product.Follow team development processes.Based on the nature of the project and the available tools, learn, and adapt quickly to different technologies and tools than the ones you are used to.As a principal, you are expected toLead and mentor data scientists in client projectsFocus on the business value generated by artificial intelligenceInterface more frequently with clientsImprove team processesBe tools agnosticQualificationsSc. or Ph.D. in machine learning or a relevant discipline.Expert level in Python including Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learnSolid understanding of deep learning techniquesFamiliar with PySpark and MLlibFamiliar with Excel, Tableau or PowerBI for visualizationNatural Language Processing experienceHave considerable experience in any of the following domains telco, government, or bankingIntermediate level in either C, Java, C++, or C#Intermediate level in SQLSoftware engineering experience (OOP, Agile methodologies, Git, continuous development, etc.)Familiar with Docker, Kubernetes, DevOPS and MLopsAnalytical rigorExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent technical & business presentation skillsAbility to do pre-sales activitiesProfessional consulting background at the corporate levelOur CompanyTeradata is the connected multi-cloud data platform for enterprise analytics company. These design features make Vantage the ideal platform to optimize price performance in a multi-cloud environment.

description: Job description: Purpose Statement Picture yourself in the heart of a dynamic, fast-paced environment, where you can harness the power of data to make a real impact. As a member of the Credit Collections & Recoveries data and decision science team at Capitec Bank, you'll be at the forefront of driving strategic insights and leveraging data as a competitive advantage. Join us in shaping the future of finance and unlock your true potential at Capitec Bank. title: Research Engineer in Science
description: Founded in 2014, InstaDeep is today an EMEA leader in decision-making AI products for the Enterprise, with headquarters in London, and offices in Paris, Berlin, Tunis, Lagos, Dubai, Cape Town and the USA. InstaDeep has been named among the Top 100 global AI startups for three consecutive years by CB Insights, as well as one of the 100 most promising B2B companies in Europe, by Sifted. We have created an environment that ensures a challenge by working closely with a broad spectrum of high-quality clients, pushing you to thrive in an environment that’s rarely tedious and always looking to push you to come up with outside-the-box solutions using cutting-edge technologies. In our mission to stay ahead of the curve, we are proud to partner with firms such as BioNTech SE, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA and Intel, and world-class universities such as MIT, Oxford, UCL, and Imperial College London. We are also an NVIDIA Elite Service Delivery Partner and Google Cloud Partner.Job DescriptionInstaDeep is looking for an experienced Research Engineer to join our expanding Research team in Cape Town. The research focus of the team is on generalist systems including aspects of reinforcement learning, meta-learning and foundation models. In this role, a particular focus will be on the development of novel research within the aforementioned fields applied to biological systems. Our efforts within this context are towards developing valuable research works and breakthroughs in generalist AI applied to biology that were previously out of reach.In the Research team, the role of a Research Engineer is to contribute to the research efforts of the team through the development and implementation of novel ideas, whilst building effective, modular and sustainable software solutions. The core tasks of a Research Engineer include: developing prototype applications, providing programming support to research projects, implementing software libraries, running experiments, and contributing to the team’s publication efforts.We welcome applications from any background and foster an open and accepting environment. InstaDeepers are naturally helpful people who want to help others grow and succeed. We strongly encourage and support applications from underrepresented groups in the tech industry .Responsibilities Collaborate with other researchers and domain experts to develop machine-learning methods for problems in computational biology.  Assist research scientists in implementing and testing novel research ideas.  Contribute to the design and implementation of models, tools and libraries to accelerate our research effort.  Adapt neural network algorithms to deploy on supercomputing architectures to best exploit modern parallel environments.  Report and present experimental results and research findings clearly and effectively, both internally and externally, verbally and in writing.  Contribute to the team’s publication efforts.  Bridge the gap between the research and product teams by integrating new fundamental research into applied projects. Minimum Requirements Work permit for South Africa.  M.S./Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning or related field.  Experience using Deep Learning frameworks such as Jax, PyTorch and/or Tensorflow.  Experience in developing and debugging in Python or similar languages.  Ability to understand, replicate and adapt to industrial standards research works.  Software engineering experience (Object-Oriented Programming, Unit Testing, Profiling, CI, Docker) via previous work or contributions to open-source projects.  Experience with high-performance computing methods and frameworks such as MPI, Ray (distribution on clusters of CPUs and accelerators).  Excellent communication skills and collaborative spirit. Nice-To-Haves 2-5 years experience.  Reinforcement Learning, Meta-Learning, and/or Natural Language Processing experience.  Structural biology or molecular dynamics experience.  Proven ability to contribute to research at the highest level by publishing scientific papers in top academic venues (e.g. NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, Nature, etc.) and/or workshops in domains related to Artificial Intelligence and/or BioInformatics. Benefits Competitive salary.  Work in small, diverse teams on collaborative research where you can make an impact.  Cooperation across European, UK, US and African offices  Flexible working hours.  Supportive atmosphere and unique opportunities to grow, learn and contribute to the larger research community. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion commitmentsAt InstaDeep, we empower individuals to celebrate their uniqueness. Our team comes from all walks of life, and we highly encourage and support applicants to apply from underrepresented groups. Our commitment to creating an authentic environment comes from our ability to learn and grow from our diversity.At present we operate in a hybrid way allowing work from home or work from the office as per each individual’s preferences. We are continuing to review the situation with the well-being of InstaDeepers at the forefront of our minds.Right to work : Please note you will require the legal right to work in the location you are applying for. Any further questions please do not hesitate to contact us at: talent@instadeep.comExamples of our research at the intersection of AI and biology Designing a Prospective COVID-19 Therapeutic with Reinforcement Learning  Peptide-MHC Structure Prediction With Mixed Residue and Atom Graph Neural Network  ManyFold: an efficient and flexible library for training and validating protein folding models  Early Computational Detection of Potential High Risk SARS-CoV-2 Variants

We are leveraging AI to build software systems focussed on security and protecting society as we know it.We care about the influence of AI and ensuring it positively affects our everyday lives and by creating a conversation about this technology we can prove its benefits.On our mission to build and deploy these world-leading technology systems, we are looking for AI Engineers that can join in our vision for the future, by tackling some of the most complex challenges in AI technology.As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for integrating pioneering research and models into complex systems, with an outcome-oriented approach.You will work internal and external stakeholders to define project requirements, identify challenges and opportunities, and co-ordinate with customers to outline technological capabilities.To Be a Suitable Candidate, You Will HaveA relevant degree i.e. computer science or electrical engineeringCommercial experience using Rust (supported by experience with other languages, such as Python, C++ or JavaBe interested in solving some of the hardest challenges in AI systemsYou Will Benefit FromSalary up to £130k (DOE)Hybrid workingEquity optionsWorking alongside a world-class team of engineers, researchers and clientsApply now for immediate consideration for this excellent Senior Rust Engineer opportunity!Understanding Recruitment is acting as an employment agency for this Senior Rust Engineer vacancy.

title: Balancing Costs Data Scientist
description: About The RoleClimate change is the challenge of a generation, and the time to act is now. Join us and you wont just be touching the lives of almost everyone in Great Britain you will be shaping the way we use and consume energy for generations to come.The Team Will Be Accountable ForThe Balancing Costs team is a new team being set up within National Control in response to the rapid increase in balancing costs in the last three years.Ensuring the ESO has a coordinated plan to manage balancing costs and work with other teams to ensure that this is implemented, providing the narrative on this plan to internal and external stakeholders.Leading Balancing Cost related improvement activities within and across the ESO; managing and prioritising the backlog of improvement ideas.The Balancing Costs Data scientist will support this newly established team in the following ways:Work with large internal and external databases to mine, clean and analyse data, and creating exploratory tools or models, using python and SQLIdentify trends and insights which with enable the team to deliver on the objectives of the balancing costs strategy. Ensure integrity, accuracy, and transparency across all the aspects of the data use. Assure quality control for all the processes and data and improve overall quality by enhancing optimisation, tooling, and testing.Communicate findings by creating clear, concise, and visually appealing data dashboards and visualisations accompanied by clear commentary on its impact and potential to internal stakeholders.Construct customer-facing reporting tools to provide insights and metrics.Collaborate with the team to evolve and build the balancing costs strategy based on the findings of your analysis.Identify areas of innovation and improvement in how we collect and utilise data to form an improved view of balancing costsCollaborate with internal teams on all data analytics going on across the ESO that is related to balancing cost. This role will be based in Warwick or Wokingham. We continue to offer hybrid working from office and home. This is a full-time role, and we offer flexible working arrangements.Key AccountabilitiesProvide the analytical evidence and insights needed to support delivery of the ESOs strategic commitments on balancing costs under our RIIO2 business planProvide new cost infographics that will form the content of Internal Balancing Costs Hub with the possibility of being published externally Grow and improve the data analytics capability within the team and in the wider ESOAbout YouExcellent data extraction and analytical data science skills: whether in Python, C/C++, SQL, or other programming languageSome knowledge or experience using data lakes e.g., AzureExcellent communication skills (verbal and written) including data visualisation techniques. Ability to problem solve and innovate with complex and incomplete datasets A team player and eager to learnDiversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of who we are and what we do. Our commitment to these values is unwavering and they are central to our mission. We encourage applications from all backgrounds, communities and industries and we are happy to discuss any reasonable adjustments that you require.What You'll GetThis role offers a competitive salary between £48,000 - £60,000 per annum dependant on capability. As well as your base salary, you will receive a bonus based on personal and company performance and a competitive contributory pension scheme where we will double match your contribution to a maximum company contribution of 12%. You will also have access to several flexible benefits such as a share incentive plan, salary sacrifice car and technology schemes, support via employee assistance lines and matched charity giving to name a few.About UsAs the Electricity System Operator (ESO) for Great Britain we are in a privileged position. We sit at the heart of the energy system, balancing electricity supply and demand second by second. We keep the lights on and the electricity flowing directly to where its needed.We are also thinking about where our energy will come from in the future and how we will operate a greener and cleaner system. One of the goals we have set for ourselves is to be able to run a zero-carbon electricity system by 2025. This will be instrumental in helping the UK meet its wider zero-carbon target.More Information This role closes on April 16th, 2023, at 23:59, however we encourage candidates to submit their application as early as possible and not wait until the published closing date as this can vary.At National Grid ESO, we work towards the highest standards in everything we do, including how we support, value, and develop our people. Our aim is to encourage and support employees to thrive and be the best they can be. We celebrate the difference people can bring into our organisation, and welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds, and offer flexible and tailored support, at home and in the office.We're committed to building a workforce that represents the communities we serve, and a working environment in which each individual feels valued, respected, treated, and able to reach their full potential.

title: Data Scientist-(H/F)
description: Vos missions au quotidienLe Data Scientist a pour mission la conception, le développement et l'amélioration de modèles analytiques permettant de créer de la valeur ajoutée pour les métiers et d'aider la banque dans ses prises de décision.Missions principales :Développer des use cases de bout en bout, en collaboration avec la Digital Factory ainsi que les lignes métiersConcevoir et développer les modèles de machine learning et de data mining nécessaires à la livraison de la solution définie par l’équipe projetFaire évoluer les modélisations et améliorer l'efficacité des modèles conçus tenant compte des retours des métiers ainsi que des résultats terrains obtenusRécupérer et analyser les données pertinentes liées au processus de production de l’entreprise, à la vente ou encore liées aux données client et ce afin d'apporter une information décisionnelleConstruire des algorithmes permettant d’améliorer les résultats de recherches et de ciblageÉlaborer des modèles prédictifs afin d’anticiper l’évolution des données et tendances relatives à l’activité de l’entrepriseModéliser les résultats d'analyse des données et les présenter avec des recommandations et des plans d'actions exploitables par les managers métierAnalyser les données, mettre en place des reportings, via l'outil 'Data Vis', qui serviront la prise de décision et formuler des recommandations BusinessParticiper au recrutement d’experts Big Data pour compléter l’équipe qui travaille sur le traitement des donnéesFaire de la recherche et développement relative au traitement de grands volumes de donnéesAutomatiser et sécuriser le traitement Data Science sur les plateformes dédiéesMener une veille sur les sujets relatifs à son périmètre et être une force de proposition et d'innovation Et si c’était vous ?Profil recherché :De Formation Bac +5, diplôme d'ingénieur ou diplôme en mathématiques, statistiques, économétrie.5 ans d'expérience dans le développement et l’application de modèles prédictifsCompétences métier :Méthodologies AnalyticsApprentissage automatique (Machine Learning)Exploration de donnéesStatistiquesAlgorithme / Codage / Programmation Pourquoi nous choisir ?Chez Société Générale, nous sommes convaincus que les personnes sont moteurs du changement, et que le monde de demain sera fait de toutes leurs initiatives, des plus petites aux plus ambitieuses.Que vous nous rejoigniez pour quelques mois, quelques années ou toute votre carrière, ensemble nous avons les moyens d’avoir un impact positif sur l’avenir. Créer, oser, innover, entreprendre font partie de notre ADN.Si vous aussi vous souhaitez être dans l’action, évoluer dans un environnement stimulant et bienveillant, vous sentir utile au quotidien et développer ou renforcer votre expertise, nous sommes faits pour nous rencontrer !Nous sommes un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à promouvoir tous les talents, quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, origine ethnique, nationalité, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

title: Senior Data Scientist - Credit Analysis
description: Founded in 2018, MaxAB is a rapidly growing food and grocery B2B e-commerce and distribution platform that serves a network of traditional retailers (mom-and-pop stores) across the MENA region. Using proprietary technology, MaxAB offers a transformative pull-driven supply chain and a tech-product that empowers both traditional retailers and suppliers. MaxAB offers traditional retailers the simplicity of dealing with one supplier, transparent pricing, on-demand delivery, and a range of value-added and embedded finance solutions. Suppliers benefit from MaxAB’s end-to-end supply chain solutions and business intelligence tools that allow them to accurately predict, monitor, and control the impact of their strategies in real time.Our MaxAB talent are dedicated to uphold the MaxAB culture and values all while continuing to grow and improve services for our clients. They are innovating new ways to help improve the quality of life of the Egyptian retailer and soon to other retailers globally.If you are passionate about working hard to make an impact and innovate new solutions, MaxAB is looking for top talent.Job SummaryWe’re looking for a Senior Data Sientist who will be a significant contributor of company's data driven automated decision making, risk management and profits optimization. The Senior Data Scientist shall have extensive experience with credit and profit scoring, the development and deployment of advanced algorithms, and the day-to-day risk management of large portfolio of loans. He/She will have the capability (i) to perform advanced risk analytics, (ii) design and develop statistical and machine learning algorithms for credit issuance and risk management, and (iii) operationalize them in the daily risk management activities of retailer’s portfolios with the aim to optimize profits.ResponsibilitiesManage portfolios of micro-loans with the use of advanced algorithms and analytics to optimize profits.Develop and deploy advanced credit risk models and algorithms.Design, develop and implement scorecards for nano- and micro-finance.Analyze large data volumes to identify credit risk factors.Develop strategies for credit risk management and revenue maximization.Transfer knowledge on credit risk model development and managementRequirementsBachelor`s degree in a relevant major.Minimum 5 years of experience in Data Science and Credit ScoringPython, PostgreSQL, Big Query, TableauExperience in Credit Scoring is a must.

title: Research Engineer - BioAI
description: Founded in 2014, InstaDeep is today an EMEA leader in decision-making AI products for the Enterprise, with headquarters in London, and offices in Paris, Berlin, Tunis, Lagos, Dubai, Cape Town and the USA. InstaDeep has been named among the Top 100 global AI startups for three consecutive years by CB Insights, as well as one of the 100 most promising B2B companies in Europe, by Sifted. We have created an environment that ensures a challenge by working closely with a broad spectrum of high-quality clients, pushing you to thrive in an environment that’s rarely tedious and always looking to push you to come up with outside-the-box solutions using cutting-edge technologies. In our mission to stay ahead of the curve, we are proud to partner with firms such as BioNTech SE, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA and Intel, and world-class universities such as MIT, Oxford, UCL, and Imperial College London. We are also an NVIDIA Elite Service Delivery Partner and Google Cloud Partner .At BioAI, we advance healthcare and push the boundaries of medical science through a combination of expertise in biology and machine learning. We launched a portfolio of initiatives across drug discovery and design, protein engineering, etc. In Dec. 2020, InstaDeep released DeepChain , an AI-powered, cloud-native, GPU-accelerated platform for protein design. Its core functionalities are built on a proven optimization framework leveraging state-of-the-art search algorithms and protein language models. Another key research area is the development of next-generation vaccines and biopharmaceuticals for the treatment of cancer and the prevention and therapy of infectious diseases, including COVID-19.InstaDeep is looking for Research Engineers to join our BioAI team in Cape Town. The current focus of the team is the use of deep learning methods for the development of personalised immunotherapy .Interested, if so then keep reading….In collaboration with research engineers and computational biologists from the BioAI team, you will be contributing to the development of new approaches in molecular modelling, protein interactions, protein designs and other related domains, by applying your technical, analytical, and research skills. You will understand the underlying bioinformatics and business problems and follow the latest developments in both machine learning and biology to identify and harness the right technologies to solve the problems, improve the existing solutions and take part in the commercial deployment of their solution. You will collaborate with a multi-functional team, experiment with different approaches, analyse and communicate the results, in order to deliver proof of concepts, minimum viable products, and ensure continuous improvement and maintenance for industrialised solutions. You will also be responsible for writing high-quality, maintainable, well-documented, and modular software libraries.Keywords: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Language Models, Transformers, Graph Neural Networks, Protein Representations, Computational Biology, Statistics, Data Analysis, High-Performance ComputingThe Research Engineer Must Accomplish The Following Design, implement and deliver performant and scalable algorithms based on state-of-the-art machine learning, deep learning and bioinformatics methodologies using distributed computing systems (CPUs, GPUs, TPUs, Cloud, etc.).  Conduct rigorous data analysis and statistical modelling to explain and improve models.  Write high-quality, maintainable, and modular code together with concise documentation.  Manipulate large and complex biology datasets.  Report and present results and development work clearly and effectively, both internally and externally, verbally and in writing.  Follow and communicate the latest developments in machine learning and biology.  Actively collaborate with the business development team in the pre sales activities, including but not limited to presenting the company to new prospective clients, writing decks and proposals, participating in calls and meetings, and representing Instadeep in conferences/events. Requirements Work permit for full-time employment in South Africa.  Master, PhD degree or equivalent experience (projects or previous work) in applied mathematics, computer science, or related scientific field.  Expert knowledge of Deep Learning for NLP (RNN, Transformer).  Experience in machine learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and software engineering demonstrated via previous work, publications, contributions to open source projects, or coding competitions.  Proficient software engineering experience in Python.  Experience using deep learning frameworks such as Jax, PyTorch, Tensorflow.  Proficiency with Git workflow and development with best coding practices.  Excellent communication skills in English. NICE-TO-HAVES Proven ability to contribute to open-source and/or research communities, including publishing scientific papers at conferences (NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, etc.).  Relevant experience in statistics, bioinformatics, and high-performance computing is a plus. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion commitmentsWe empower individuals to celebrate their uniqueness here at InstaDeep. Our team comes from all walks of life, and we’re proud to continue encouraging and supporting applicants from underrepresented groups across the globe. Our commitment to creating an authentic environment comes from our ability to learn and grow from our diversity, and how better to experience this by other than by joining our team?At present we operate in a hybrid way allowing work from home or work from the office as per each individual’s preferences. We are continuing to review the situation with the well-being of InstaDeepers at the forefront of our minds.Right to work: Please note you will require the legal right to work in the location you are applying for.Any further questions please do not hesitate to contact us at: talent@instadeep.com
location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
